reviews.review_msg: Others have commented on Stephanie being unfriendly, cold, and smug, and that's exactly it. She does not have a passion for teaching, and it shows. Stephanie knows urban planning but struggles to keep students tuned in. She is a very difficult marker too.

She was my TA. Not only does she mark really hard but she seems to be a bit of a cold person. Seems rather unfriendly and smug. However she does try to explain material well and adresses any questions students may have about the material. Did I mention marks extremely hard? Her expections are very high so be prepared to work very hard.
Hands down the best Geog prof at SFU. ...well him or Geoff Mann. Awesome course, doing the readings is a must but what you will get out of it is beyond worth it.

This guy is slightly off his rocker. He made us write one brutal paper, it was almost like writing a journal article. Also marks very hard...so be on your game and do your readings! This course should be 5 credits rather than 4...

WOW EXTREMELY HARD marker. The expectations are insanely high in this class but I think all economic geography courses are like this. You have write an empirical research paper. Its almost like trying to write like a paper for your MBA. He is a good lecturer though; He explains concepts well. ALOT of readings and be prepared to work your butt off!

Excellent professor with superb teaching style and excellent clarification of confusing topics (rare). He is very attractive, which made it somewhat difficult to concentrate. He is very interested in the subject matter which makes for very interesting classes and discussions. He usually makes comments about himself and his family, and then blushes!

I had no interest in taking this class but it turned out to be one of my favorites.  There are lots of readings every week and the paper can be a choice of topics covered in class dealing with Vancouver.  If you need a 'W' course, take this class.  Eugene is a good lecturer and encourages questions.
Marking is Hard but Prof is great..no text book but lots of readings....only take course if interested in planning but overall i like course and he is a great prof.
He's really nice and has a good sense of humour, he's really easy going. He makes the course material interesting.

Interesting class! It's hard to understand him at times with his accent though. You only need to know the main points and the term paper was very interesting. Highly recommanded if you are doing a Geography major/minor.

He has issues with powerpoint and ends up wasting a lot of time in class fiddling with it. He also uses examples almost solely from America. His marking scheme is very inconsistent, but he's helpful if you go and talk to him.

Wayne is a dull lecturer and shows little interest towards student. Reads right off his slides and loses his train of thought constantly. Gives irrelevant instructions for assignments then instructs us to disregard them and follow new instructions that have no content. DO NOT TAKE, would not recommend. Assignments are time consuming, worth little.
Boring, unenthusiastic lecturer. Doesn't seem to care very much for his students. Unfair marker and does not provide sufficient feedback. Really doesn't seem to be a very experienced prof.

Wayne is dull, he seems more like a professional rather than a professor because he assumes his class is the only one students are taking. His assignments that are worth very little take hours to complete and he just repeats course readings in class so what's the point in reading? But he seems like a nice guy otherwise.
